message: I'm looking at building a KRL ruleset filesystem that would make your rulesets look like local files. I could build it like the current 'krl' gem, where you work with a local copy and then 'commit' your changes. I could also make it live, so whenever you write to the files the changes go immediately to Kynetx. Either way you would still have a "deploy" command taht would deploy the 'current' version.
Would you rather have it be 'commit on save' or do you prefer to manually commit (when you feel like it)? Any downside to 'commit on save'?

I wouldn't save a ruleset and go away from my computer. I will always test it right after the saving so that when I work on it again I know I have something stable. In order to test my changes I need them to be commited so I would opt for "commit on save" .
That brings up an interesting point. 'Commit on save' means I can run the whole thing in memory. Otherwise I have to make a local copy of any changes, something that will survive a reboot.
